summary: The Water Resources Technical Assistance Review Act mandates the Comptroller General of the United States to review the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) clean water-related technical assistance programs. The review will assess the scope, effectiveness, and coordination of these programs, focusing on how the EPA selects and partners with technical assistance providers, particularly in supporting communities and economically distressed areas. The Comptroller General will submit a report with findings and recommendations to relevant congressional committees. The EPA Administrator is required to provide a plan for compliance with the recommendations.
